summary: THROTTLE STUCK AT HIGH RPMS AND GAS PEDAL STUCK TO THE FLOOR  HAD TO TURN OFF THE IGNITION BEFORE IT BLEW UP MY TRUCK.    THIS WAS SUPPOSED TO HAVE BEEN REPAIRED IN JANUARY BY FORD IN VENTURA AND NOW IT IS HAPPENING AGAIN THIS HAS HAPPENED TO SO MANY RANGERS AND ONE OF US OWNERS OF WILL WIND UP KILLED.  FIX THIS PLEASE
GAS TANK CRACKED AT 86000 MILES CAN'T HOLD MORE THEN HALF A TANK.  TRANSMISSION WEARING OUT AND DRIVEN LIGHTLY NEVER USED THE BED OF TRUCK TO CARRY THINGS MAINLY FREEWAY MILES

HOW CAN THE FRAME OF MY TRUCK RUST OUT FASTER THAN THE BED OR CAB. THE CAB MOUNTS ARE GONE. THE SHACKLES OF THE LEAF SPRINGS ARE PAPER THIN AND READY TO COLLAPSE. WHEN I DRIVE DOWN THE ROAD AND HIT A BUMP IT SOUNDS LIKE THE CAB IS GOING FALL TO THE GROUND. I AM AFRAID ONE OF THESE DAYS , I'LL GET IN AN ACCIDENT AND THE ENTIRE CAB IS GOING TO FLY OFF THE TRUCK. THE MOTOR HAS OUTLASTED THE FRAME. MAKE LAUGH.

1993 FORD RANGER SEVERE FRAME / SUSPENSION RUST.      ON THE REAR LEAF SPRING HAVE HAD TO REPLACE FRONT AND REAR HANGERS / SHACKLES.  THE OEM ONES RUSTED COMPLETELY THROUGH AND LET THE LEAF SPRINGS BREAK LOOSE.  ONLY CONTACT WAS ON THE SPRING EYELET HITTING THE BOTTOM FOR THE TRUCK BED.    HAVE ALSO HAD TO REPLACE THE CAB MOUNTS,  ALSO RUSTED COMPLETELY THROUGH SO THAT THE REAR OF THE CAB WAS SITTING ON THE FRAME.    THE FRAME IS ALSO SHOWING SEVERE CORROSION.  THE FARTHER BACK THE WORSE IT IS.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 FORD RANGER. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS BEING SERVICED, THE MECHANIC NOTICED THAT THE STEERING COUPLER WAS FRACTURED IN MULTIPLE PLACES AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 176,000.

THE GOVERNOR FOR THE 90 MPH GOVERNOR WAS RECALLED BY THE CONSUMER AGENCY RESPONSIBLE FOR RECALLS.  THE PROBLEM WAS THAT IT WAS A POTENTIAL FIRE HAZARD.   I  CALLED UPON FORD SEVERAL TIMES OVER A PERIOD OF YEARS, AS WELL AS WENT BY THE FORD SHOP AND WAS TOLD THAT IT WAS NOT PERTAINING TO MY 1993 FORD RANGER.  NOT UNTIL AFTER THE TRUCK BROKE AND WOULD NOT SHIFT DID FORD PRETEND TO FIX THE PROBLEM AS A RECALL, BUT, ALSO CHARGED 1000 DOLLARS.  THE TRUCK DID NOT  FILL LIKE IT WAS FIXED PROPERLY I APPROACHED THE LANDERS FORD COLLIERVILLE OF COLLIERVILLE TENNESSEE AND HE STATED IT WAS FIXED.  THEY THEN TRIED TO SELL ME ANOTHER TRUCK.  ANY WAY THE TRUCK DID NOT GO ANOTHER 500 MILES BEFORE BREAKING AND GETTING REAR ACCIDENT BY A HIT AND RUN DRIVER.  FORD TOOK MY 1000 DOLLARS AND DID NOT FIX MY TRUCK AND ARE STILL IGNORANT TO THE DAY ABOUT MY TRUCK AND RECALL.  I AM A COMMERCIAL TRUCK DRIVER AND IN THE PERIOD OF 11 YEARS HAVE NOT PUT BUT 57000 MILES AND DO NOT NEED A NEW TRUCK FROM FORD THEN OR NOW OR EVER WITH SUCH BUSINESS TACTICS.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 FORD RANGER WITH FIRESTONE TIRES, SIZE: P225/70/R14. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING 70 MPH, THE REAR DRIVER SIDE TIRE TREAD SEPARATED FROM THE TIRE, CAUSING THE CONTACT TO CRASH INTO A HIGHWAY DIVIDER. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS DESTROYED AND THE CONTACT SUSTAINED INJURIES. A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 93,000. THE VIN WAS UNAVAILABLE.

WAS DRIVING AROUND 50 TO 55 MPH WHEN I SEEN SMOKE COMING FROM TRUCK  SO I PULLED OVER TO SEE WHAT WAS WRONG AND SEEN TRANSMISSION FLUID POURING OUT OF TRANSMISSION ONTO EXHAUST PIPE  THIS HAS HAPPEN TWICE NOW DON,T KNOW WHY COMING FROM FRONT OF TRANSMISSION AUTO  3.0 ENGINE ONLY WHEN  I KICK IT IN OVERDRIVE IT  HAPPENS.  *TR

THE FRAME HAS RUSTED UNTIL THE TRUCK IS NO LONGER DRIVABLE. IT IS FOUR WHEEL DRIVE AND I HAVE ALREADY REPLACED THE REAR SPRING SHACKLES WHEN THEY RUSTED OUT IN 2006. I BOLTED A PIECE OF ANGLE TO THE TRANSMISSION SUPPORT TO REPAIR IT AFTER IT RUSTED INTO AND DROPPED THE TRANSMISSIOM AND TWISTED THE DRIVE SHAFT INTO WHILE DRIVING DOWN THE ROAD  I TOOK IT UP ON 2/9/2012 TO GET A NEW EXHAUST PUT ON IT AND AND GOT A CALL FROM THE SERVICE GARAGE TO COME LOOK AT THE UNDER CARRAIGE OF THE TRUCK. THE BED HAS A RUSTED OUT SUPPORT, THE TRANSMISSION SUPPORT CROSSMEMBER IS RUSTED INTO ON THE OTHER SIDE FROM WHERE I REPAIRED IT BEFORE AND THE FRONT SUPPORT CROSSMEMBER UNDER THE RADIATOR IS RUSTED OUT. THE SUPPORT FOR THE SPARE TIRE RUSTER OUT YEARS AGO. THE ENGINE AND DRIVE TRAIN WORK GREAT BUT THE TRUCK IS SCRAP NOW BECAUSE THERE IS NOTHING LEFT OF THE FRAME AND BODY SUPPORTS.   *TR

ON MY 1993 FORD RANGER,MY BRAKE & CLUTCH MOUNTING BRACKET FAILED DUE TO STRESS FRACTURE OF WELDS. THIS CAUSED LOSE OF BRAKES AND USE OF CLUTCH. FORD HAS A RECALL ON FAILURE OF STUDS ON THE POWER BRAKE BOOSTER THAT IS MOUNTED ON THIS BRACKET, BUT NOTHING ON THE FAILURE OF THE BRACKET.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 FORD RANGER.  THE CONTACT STATED THE FRONT FRAME WAS CORRODED AND RUSTED. THE DEALER WAS CONTACT AND OFFERED NO ASSISTANCE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 138,761.  UPDATED 07/08/11*LJ  UPDATED 08/05/11
FRAME IS ROTTING - REPAIRED THE REAR SECTION AND NOW THE FRONT IS ROTTING WHERE THE SHOCKS/SPRINGS ARE MOUNTED TO THE FRAME.  THE ENTIRE FRAME IS A MESS BUT THE REST OF THE BODY IS GOOD. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS 1993 FORD RANGER. WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED THE CONTACT TRIED TO APPLY THE PARKING BRAKE AND IT WOULD LOCK IN PLACE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT TAKEN TO THE DEALER TO BE REPAIRED. THE DEALER WAS CONTACTED AND STATED THAT THERE WAS A RECALL ON THAT YEAR, MAKE AND MODEL BUT HIS VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 130,000.

NOTICED  GASOLINE RUNS FROM UNDER TRUCK WHEN TANK IS FILLED UP WITH GAS.  ON 11/30/2010, FILLER NECK ON  FUEL TANK CRACKED PROFUSELY AS WELL AS FUEL INDUCTOR LINE; FUEL WAS POURING OUT UNDER TRUCK AS I WATCHED THE GAS GAUGE GO FROM 1/4 OF A TANK FULL TO EMPTY IN 2 SECONDS. DEALER INDICATES THAT ORIGINAL FUEL INDUCTOR LINES (THAT FITS ON TOP OF TANK)  AND TANK ARE NO LONGER AVAILABLE FROM FORD DEALER. ENTIRE FUEL SYSTEM MUST BE REPLACED. *TR

1993 FORD RANGER FUEL FILLER TUBE IS MADE OF STEEL AND MOUNTED SO ROAD SALT CAN CORRODE IT.  FUEL FILLER TUBE LEAKS GASOLINE ON PAVEMENT EVERY TIME I REFUEL.  PART IS $429 PLUS INSTALL.  LEAKING FUEL AT THE GASOLINE STATION SEEMS DANGEROUS, WOULD YOU AGREE? *TR
REAR BUMPER LITERALLY FELL OFF.  INVESTIGATION REVEALED NON REPAIRABLE RUST TO FRAME AND BUMPER BRACKETS.  FRAME IS SEVERELY RUSTED. *TR

FUEL FILLER NECK HAS SPLIT AT THE TANK CONNECTION BEND. FUEL LEAKS PROFUSELY OUT OF THIS SPLIT WHEN TANK IS FILLED. WHEN THE TANK REACHES FULL CAPACITY, THE FUEL FILLER OUTER HOSE FILLS UP PARTIALLY. THE FUEL IN THE OUTER HOSE THEN LEAKS OUT ONTO THE TANK AND GROUND. I AM REPEATING THIS CLAIM FOR 2 SEPARATE VEHICLES, A '93 AND A '94. *TR
TRUCK CAUGHT ON FIRE FOR NO REAOSN. IT WAS BEING WARMED UP. *TR

WHILE DRIVING HOME THE TRUCK DROPPED ON THE PASSENGER'S SIDE SUDDENLY. THE FRONT SPRING HOUSING ON THE PASSENGER'S SIDE OF 1993 V6 FORD RANGER TRUCK RUSTED AND BROKE.  THIS COULD HAVE BEEN CATASTROPHIC IF I WOULD HAVE BEEN ON THE HIGHWAY DRIVING AT 55 MPH. PLEASE ADVISE IF THIS  WAS SOMETHING THAT FORD KNEW ABOUT,  AND IF THEY WERE WILLING TO FIX IT. THE TRUCK IS IN GOOD SHAPE OTHERWISE AND RUNS WELL- JUST LEAKS A LITTLE ENGINE OIL. *AK

I NEVER RECEIVED ANY RECALL NOTIFICATION ON NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID  NUMBER 06E026000.  THE WEDGE ALLUDED TO IN NHTSA  RECALL WAS INSTALLED ON THE TRUCK AND DID NOT SOLVE THE PROBLEM.  THE EMERGENCY BRAKE WOULD STILL NOT LOCK INTO PLACE, AND NOW DID NOT WORK AT ALL.  *AK

TL* - THE CONTACT CALLED REGARDING THE  1993 FORD RANGER.  THE CONTACT WAS TRAVELING AT  40 MPH AND  THE REAR END OF THE VEHICLE SUDDENLY CAME CRASHING DOWN AND SEVERED THE BRAKE LINE, THERE WERE NO WARNING INDICATORS.  THE CONTACT WAS ABLE TO PULL THE VEHICLE OVER TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD.  THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A REPAIR SHOP.  THE VEHICLE WAS DIAGNOSED AS HAVING  CORRODED REAR SHACKLES.  THE FRONT AND REAR SHACKLES WERE REPLACED AS WELL AS THE BRAKES.  *AK  UPDATED 2/27/2007 -*NM

TL* -  THE CONTACT'S 1993 FORD RANGER CAUGHT ON FIRE.  THERE WERE NO WARNINGS PRIOR TO THE INCIDENT.   THE CONTACT WAS TRAVELING APPROXIMATELY 65 MPH WITH AN ODOMETER READING OF 84000 AT THE TIME OF THE FAILURE.   THE CONTACT PURCHASED THE VEHICLE ON 11/7/06 FROM A PRIVATE OWNER.  THE THROW-OUT BEARING WAS REPLACED ON 11/9/06.   THE ROAD CONDITIONS WERE DRY AND CLEAR.  THE VEHICLE SPUTTERED SO  THE CONTACT PULLED OFF THE HIGHWAY. THE VEHICLE LOST POWER, AND A FIRE STARTED UNDER THE HOOD OF THE VEHICLE. PASSENGER COMPARTMENT ALSO CAUGHT ON FIRE AND WAS DESTROYED.*AK  UPDATED 03/02/07. *JB

UNEXPECTED FIRE UNDER HOOD AFTER TURNING THE DEFROSTER SWITCH ON.  WHILE DRIVING IN A PARKING GARAGE MY NEPHEW WHO WAS DRIVING AT THE TIME TURNED THE DEFROSTER SWITCH ON AND ALL OF A SUDDEN THERE WAS SMOKE BELLOWING OUT OF THE VENTS INTO THE FORD RANGER PK/U CAB.    HE PULLED OVER TO THE SIDE OF THE LOT AND SOMEONE RAN UP TO HIM AND TOLD HIM TO GET OUT OF THE PK/U BECAUSE HE SAW FIRE COMING FROM UNDER THE HOOD.  THE GUY WAS CARRYING A FIRE EXTINGUISHED. HE TOLD MY NEPHEW TO SLOWLY LIFT THE HOOD WHILE HE BEGAN TO EXTINGUISH THE FIRE UNDER THE HOOD.  THE FLAMES WHERE VERY INTENSE THAT IT MELTED THE HEATER CORE COVER, WIRING, THE A/C MOTOR AND FAN AND PAINT ON THE INSIDE AND OUT SIDE OF VEHICLE.  IT ALSO MELTED THE INSIDE OF THE DASH BOARD WHERE THE ON THE OTHER SIDE WOULD BE YOUR GLOVE COMPARTMENT.  IN THE MEANTIME NEPHEW CALLED 911 AND FIRE DEPT WAS DISPATCHED AND THEY GOT THERE FEW MINUTES LATER AND THE FIRE HAD BEEN PUT OUT ALREADY BUT AS A PRECAUTION THEY FOAMED THE CAR ENGINE AND UNHOOKED THE BATTERY.  HE WAS TOLD TO NOT START THE TRUCK AGAIN AND HAVE IT FLAT BEDDED TO GARAGE FOR INSPECTION AND POSSIBLE REPAIR.    I CALLED FORD AND THEY TOOK REPORT WHICH WILL TAKE 7-10 DAYS TO GET INSPECTOR HERE IN FL TO LOOK AT VEHICLE.  THIS WAS A 1993 FORD RANGER, 2 DOOR,STAND BED, 4CYL, MANUAL.  THIS TRUCK JUST BURST INTO FLAMES WITH THE ONLY CAUSE THAT MECHANICS HAVE FOUND SO FAR WAS THE MOTOR BURNED FROM THE INSIDE OUT AND HEATED SO MUCH THAT IT MELTED THE BRACKETS HOLDING IN PLACE AND WHEN IT HIT THE HEAT CORE IT MELTED IT AND ALSO THE FAN MOTOR IS MELTED AND ADHERED PERMANENTLY TO THIS HEAT CORE NOW ON THE OUTSIDE.  MY BROTHER OWNS THIS VEHICLE SINCE I GAVE IT TO HIM 1 YR AGO BUT THEY ARE STILL FAMILY AND THEIR SAFETY IS A CONCERN TO ME.  THIS SHOULD NOT HAVE HAPPENED AND THIS IS AS THE MECHANIC CLAIMS ALMOST 99% SURE IT IS DEFECTIVE PARTS.  THE HEAT WAS SO INTENSIVE EVEN THOUGHT IT WAS ONLY FOR A FEW MINS IF THAT TO DUE SO MUCH DAMAGE LIKE IT DID. *JB

GAS LEAKS FROM THE FILLER NECK AND TANK WHEN REFUELING. THE SCENT OF GASOLINE LINGERS FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS AFTER FILLUP.  THE AMOUNT OF FUEL LOST ABOUT 1/2 TO 1 GALLON.  THERE IS THE POTENTIAL FOR A POSSIBLE FIRE SINCE THIS OCCURS AT THE GAS STATION, FROM STATIC ELECTRICITY OR HEAT FROM THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER. THIS TRUCK HAS NEVER BEEN INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT OR USED OFF ROAD.  I AM A PERSONAL FRIEND OF THE ORIGINAL OWNER, WHO SOLD THE TRUCK TO MY BROTHER WHOM I OBTAINED THE TRUCK FROM.  *NM

REAR LEAF SPRING BRACKETS ( WHICH ATTACH LEAF SPRINGS TO THE FRAME) HAVE RUSTED OUT AND LEAF SPRING AND AXLE CAME LOOSE. THIS VEHICLE HAS LESS THAN 100,000 MI. IT BROKE AS I WAS PULLING IN TO MY DRIVEWAY. BOTH BRACKETS ON RIGHT SIDE WERE REPLACED AS WELL AS BRAKE LINES WHICH WERE TORN LOOSE. MECHANIC SAID LEFT SIDE BRACKETS WERE READY TO BREAK ALSO AND WILL BE REPLACED AS SOON AS HE GETS THEM ORDERED. HE SAID THIS WAS A VERY COMMON REPAIR ON FORD RANGER PICKUPS. OLD PARTS ARE AVAILABLE. *JB

GAS LEAKING FROM 93 FORD RANGER AFTER IT IS FILLED UP WITH FUEL.  THE HOSE AROUND THE FILLER NECK IS CRACKED.  THERE IS ALSO A STRONG SMELL OF FUEL FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS FOLLOWING FILLING UP THE VEHICLE. *JB

TOGGLE SWITCH ON SUNROOF HAS ALREADY BEEN REPLACED ONCE AND NOW IT HAS GONE OUT AGAIN.  DOES NOT STOP ON ITS OWN FOR OPEN AND CLOSE.  I DON'T FEEL I SHOULD HAVE TO PAY FOR SOMETHING THAT CONTINUES TO BREAK.

DT:   A RECALL WA SISSUED  BUT THIS VEHICLE  WAS  NOT INCLUDED DUE TO VIN.  WHEN  APPLYING EMERGENCY BRAKE IT DIDN'T WORK AND IT ALLOWED THE VEHICLE TO ROLL FREELY. THIS WAS FOR A MANUEL TRANSMISSION WHEN PARKING ON A HILL.  HAD TO LEAVE THE GEAR AND TURN THE WHEELS DEPENDING ON  WHICH WAY PARKED. AND HOPE OF COURSE IT WOULDN'T  ROLL INTO ANOTHER VEHICLE. THIS RECENTLY HAPPENED ON  JULY 25, 2005. *AK

DETERIORATION OF CAB MOUNTS AND ALL LEAF SPRING MOUNTS.  ALL HAD TO BE REPLACED.  ONE REAR HANGER OF THE RIGHT LEAF SPRING HAD TOTALLY RUSTED THROUGH AND THE SPRING WAS RESTING ON THE PICKUP BED.  ALL PARTS FELL APART WHEN BEING REMOVED AND ARE NOT AVAILABLE.  REPLACEMENT HAD TO BE DONE IMMEDIATELY AFTER IT WAS FOUND AS IT AFFECTED THE HANDLING ABILITY OF THE TRUCK.*AK

CONSUMER COMPLAINED OF AN EMERGENCY BRAKE PROBLEM. CONSUMER RECEIVED RECALL 94V169001 CONCERNING EMERGENCY PARKING  BRAKE: MECHANICAL.  CONSUMER WAS NEVER INFORMED OF THE RECALL. WHEN CONSUMER STEPPED ON THE BRAKE PEDAL IT DROPPED ALL THE WAY TO THE FLOOR, IF HE REPEATED THIS IT WOULD EVENTUALLY CATCH. *AK   PARKING BRAKE PEDAL OCCASIONALLY DOES NOT ENGAGE.  THE PROBLEM OCCURS FREQUENTLY.  *TC

WHEN USING THE TAILGATE, THE LEFT TAIL GATE SUPPORT STRAP SNAPPED. THIS CAUSED THE TAILGATE TO FALL.  PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION.  *JB    THE CONSUMER STATED THAT THE CABLE WAS CORRODED UNDER THE PLASTIC COVER.  *TC

WHILE APPLYING THE EMERGENCY  BRAKE IT FAILED, CAUSING THE VEHICLE TO ROLL  DOWN.   CONSUMER WAS ABLE TO MAINTAIN CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE, AND TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER FOR INSPECTION. MECHANIC  DETERMINED THAT A WEDGE NEEDED TO BE INSTALLED.  *AK

WHILE DRIVING 50 MPH CONSUMER HEARD A LOUD NOISE COMING FROM THE REAR.    CONSUMER WAS ABLE TO MAINTAIN CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE, AND PULLED OVER.  NOTICED THAT THE REAR PASSENGER TIRE TREAD WAS SEPARATING.   THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED HOME.   *AK  THE PASSENGER SIDE REAR QUARTER PANEL OF THE VEHICLE WAS DAMAGED AS A RESULT OF THE TREAD SEPARATION.  *NM
WHILE DRIVING  HOOD BLEW OPEN DUE TO  HOOD LATCH BEING DEFECTIVE. *AK

WHILE DRIVING, THE REAR PASSENGER TIRE TREAD SEPARATED.  THE CONSUMER MANAGED TO PULL OVER AND CHANGED THE TIRE. THE CAUSE WAS NOT DETERMINED.  COOPER, COBRA, P225/70R14. EVOQ FILED BY GREG CRAWFORD 217-762-2182   *AK   THE BLOWOUT OCCURRED ON A SMOOTH BLACKTOP ROAD.   *SC  THE DEALERSHIP HAS SINCE REPLACE THE TIRE.  *JB

WHILE DRIVING VEHICLE, BACK OF SEAT COLLAPSED WHEN A BOLT BROKE AND I TEMPORARILY LOST CONTROL.  VEHICLE COULD NOT BE DRIVEN AFTERWARDS, AND HAD TO BE TOWED.  FORD MOTOR COMPANY REFUSES TO REPAIR UNLESS I PAY FOR IT.*AK

WHILE DRIVING AT 55 MPH CONSUMER HEARD A THUMP AT THE LEFT REAR OF THE VEHICLE.  LEFT REAR SIDE DROPPED ABOUT SEVEN INCHES LOWER THAN THE RIGHT SIDE.  AFTER STOPPING AND FURTHER INSPECTING THE VEHICLE, THE CONSUMER FOUND A SMALL HOLE IN THE  BED.  UPON FURTHER INSPECTION  CONSUMER FOUND THAT THE LEAF SPRING HANGER BRACKET BROKE.*AK  *JB

ON 1-20-04, I STARTED MY VEHICLE TO WARM UP.  I HAD THE EMERGENCY BRAKE ENGAGED.  HOWEVER, THE EMERGENCY BRAKE SYSTEM FAILED AND THE VEHICLE ROLLED DOWN MY DRIVEWAY, INTO MY NEIGHBORS DRIVEWAY, AND HIT THEIR TRAILER AND GARAGE, CAUSING DAMAGE TO THEIR PROPERTY AND MY VEHICLE.  AFTER INVESTIGATING, I HAVE FOUND THAT THERE HAD BEEN A RECALL ON MY VEHICLE FOR THE EMERGENCY BRAKES, FOR THE SAME PROBLEM THAT CAUSED MY VEHICLE EMERGENCY BRAKE SYSTEM TO FAIL. HOWEVER I HAD NEVER RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF THE RECALL.  IN FACT, AS OF THE DATE I AM FILING THIS COMPLAINT, I CALLED FORD DEALERSHIP IN OWENSBORO, KY AND WAS TOLD BY AN EMPLOYEE IN THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT THAT THERE WERE NOT ANY RECALLS ON FORD RANGERS THAT THEY WERE AWARE. *AK
PROBLEMS WITH FIRESTONE RADIAL ATX TIRE EQUIPMENT.*MR  *MR
REAR SPRING HANGERS COMPLETELY RUSTED OUT. AS A RESULT, THE VEHICLE SHIFTED.   *AK *JB   *NM

THE REAR BRAKE CABLE GOES THOUGH A OBLONG HOLE IN THE FRAME. IN MY 1993 FORD RANGER THE OBLONG HOLE EDGE IS NOW RAZOR SHARPE. THIS CAN CAUSE A FATIQUE CRACK LEADING TO FRAME FAILURE. I USED RTV TO TRY TO KEEP THE CABLE AWAY FROM THE EDGE OF THE HOLE. THE FRAME HOLE IS NOW TOO SHARP FOR ME TO MESS WITH. I DO NOT WANT TO GET CUT.   ABOUT 1995 I CALLED FORD AND ASK ABOUT A NEW CABLE. I WAS TOLD NO DEAL.*AK

THE FUEL TANK CRACKED ON THE UPPER PORTION OF THE TANK IN THE AREA WHERE THE MIDDLE STRAP CROSSED THE TANK WHICH WAS LEAKING FUEL.   *AK   GALLONS OF FUEL LEAKED AS THE CONSUMER WAS DRIVING.  THE DEALER SUGGESTED THAT CONSUMER REPLACED THE FUEL PUMP.  THE CONSUMER OBTAINED THE DEFECTIVE FUEL TANK AND FOUND NO PROBLEM WITH THE FUEL PUMP.   *SCC  *JB

MY 1993 FORD RANGER 4WHEEL DRIVE PICK UP SUDDENLY STARTED LEAKING GAS. THE DEALERSHIP TOLD ME THAT THE GAS TANK SEPARATED AND THATS WHAT CAUSED THE LEAK. THIS VEHICLE IS 4WHEEL DRIVE, BUT I NEVER TAKE IT OFF ROADS AND I LIVE IN A VERY TEMPERATE CLIMATE (THE BAY AREA). WE HAVE NO EXTREME COLD OR HEAT AND I FIND IT HARD TO BELIEVE THIS IS NORMAL. I WANT TO MAKE SURE THIS IS NOT SOME DEFECT.

LEAF SPRING SHACKLE BRACKETS RUSTED THROUGH WHICH CAUSED THE LEAF SPRINGS TO RIDE ON THE UNDERSIDE OF THE TRUCK BED WHEN THE SHACKLES BROKE. THE SHACKLES SHOULD BE MADE OF A BETTER MATERIAL.             *JB
THE VEHICLE CAUGHT ON FIRE WHILE DRIVING.  THE DEALER HAD BEEN NOTIFIED.  TS  WHEN THE CONSUMER LIFTED THE HOOD, HE VIEWED THE FLAMES COMING FROM THE PASSENGER SIDE ENGINE COMPARTMENT.  SCC
WHILE FILLING UP GAS TANK  A HOSE WHICH IS CONNECTED TO THE TANK BEGAN TO LEAK. PLEASE PROVIDE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.  NLM

WHEN PARKED AND EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLIED VEHICLE WILL ROLL IN EITHER DIRECTION IF PARKED AT A SLIGHT INCLINE OR DOWN GRADE.*AK  CONSUMER IS AWARE THERE IS A CAMPAIGN 94591 RELATING TO THE CONDITION.  ADDITIONAL LEAVES ARE BUILDING UP IN THE HEATER COMPARTMENT.   *TT
WHILE TRAVELING ON INTERSTATE ANOTHER VEHICLE MERGED WITHOUT PRIOR WARNING.  CONSUMER APPLIED HIS BRAKES, AND SEATBELT ON DRIVER'S  SIDE BROKE.*AK

FUEL TANK CRACK ON THE UPPER PORTION OF THE TANK IN THE AREA WHERE THE MIDDLE STRAP CROSSES THE TANK.  CONTACTED FORD MOTOR CO., NO RECALLS, THEREFORE, NO ASSISTANCE WITH THE PURCHASE OF A NEW FUEL TANK, ONLY AVAILABLE FROM THE MANUFACTURER AT $335.72.  I HAVE OWNED THIS TRUCK SINCE NEW, AND IT HAS NEVER BEEN ABUSED OR DRIVEN OVER ROUGH TERRAIN TO WARRANT A FUEL TANK CRACKING AND LEAKING.*AK
ON AT LEAST 4X THE IGNITION CUT OF AT HIWAY SPEEDS.MAGARITY. *AK
THIS IS AN ONGOING PROBLEM IT HAS BEEN 4 YRS. LEFT REAR  ANTI-LOCK BRAKES WILL LOCK UP.*AK
TIRE SIDEWALL LOSS--TIRE PRESSURE CHECKED THAT A.M., LOSS AT 3:00 P.M.*AK (DOT NUMBER: YDK6  TIRESIZE: 27/8.5/14)
TREAD SEPARATION ON ONE TIRE, CRACKING AROUND EDGES POSSIBLY LEADING TO EVENTUAL TREAD SEPARATION ON OTHERS.*AK (DOT NUMBER: W2FC 1PR  TIRESIZE: P225/70R14)

VEHICLE KEEPS ENGAGING TRYING TO START ITSELF WITHOUT A KEY.  VEHICLE BOUNCES FORWARD UNTIL IT HITS SOMETHING TO STOP IT. MANUFACTURER, AND DEALER NEVER HEARD OF  PROBLEM TO FIND A REMEDY. CONSUMER ADDED A TOGGLE SWITCH ON  WIRE THAT RUNS FROM SOLENOID RELAY TO  STARTER TO KEEP IT FROM STARTING ITSELF.*AK

WHILE DRIVING COULD SMELL GASOLINE FUMES INSIDE OF VEHICLE.  STOPPED VEHICLE  AND  CHECKED BENEATH  VEHICLE. NOTICED FUEL WAS LEAKING ON  GROUND. TOOK TO DEALERSHIP, AND MECHANIC NOTICED  FUEL TANK WAS CRACKED WHICH CAUSED  FUEL TO LEAK OUT.  FUEL TANK WAS PLASTIC , AND MECHANIC REPLACED IT WITH ANOTHER TYPE.*AK

LOST ALL TREAD, TOOK OFF RIGHT FRONT FENDER, FIRESTONE DEALER SAID THAT THE TIRE WASN'T ONE OF THE RECALLED ONES SO THEY WOULD'D DO ANYTHING ABOUT IT. TIRE HAD 4/32 TREAD AT TIME OF ACCIDENT. *AK (DOT NUMBER: VD66 4RA  TIRESIZE: 30X9.50R15)
REAR BRAKE LINES RUB ON SHOCK ABSORBERS, NOT AVOIDABLE. EXTREME WEAR EVIDENT.  ALSO, HEADLIGHTS FLASH UNCONTROLABLY, SUSPECTED HEADLIGHT SWITCH REPLACEMENT.

NECK ON PLASTIC FUEL TANK CRACKED - FUEL LEAKING ALL UNDER TRUCK & ON FLOOR OF GARAGE. PROBLEM WAS NOTICED WHEN I STARTED TO MOVE TRUCK TO GO TO WORK.  AFTER BACKING TRUCK OUT OF GARAGE AND SEEING FUEL ON FLOOR, I CALLED A FOR A TOW.  DEALER INDICATES THAT PLASTIC FUEL TANK HAS CRACKED FOR NO APPARENT REASON.  NO INDICATION OF IMPACT. ORIGINAL FUEL TANK IS NOLONGER AVAILIABLE FROM FORD.  A NEW STYLE (DEALER INDICATES NEW STYLE TANK AND FUEL FILL ARE REQUIRED) REPALCEMENT IS BEING ORDERED AND INSTALLED BY THE DEALER.  WHAT WOULD MAKE A FUEL TANK CRACK WITHOUT SOME TYPE OF INPACT? I LOOKED UNDER THE TRUCK AND A LARGE AREA OF THE UNDERSIDE WAS COVERED WITH FUEL.  I THINK I WAS LUCKY NOT TO HAVE A FIRE IN MY HOUSE WHEN I STARTED THE TRUCK.  I HAD JUST FILLED UP THE TANK AND THERE WAS A CIRCLE OF FUEL ABOUT 2FT. ACROSS ON THE FLOOR OF THE GARAGE.  *AK
3RD BRAKE LIGHT (UPPER CAB) HAS OVERHEATED AND CAUSED SMALL FIRE IN BRAKE LIGHT HOUSING.  *AK   *JB
GAS PEDAL BROKE FREE FROM FIRE WALL ON INTERSTATE, LOST THROTTLE CONTROL. *AK
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK (DOT NUMBER: W2FC1PR  TIRESIZE: P225/70R14)

FRONTAL COLLISION WITH ANOTHER VEHICLE, IMPACT WAS BELOW 45 MPH.   SEAT BELT FAILED TO HOLD, AND DRIVER  SUSTAINED SEVERE INJURIES.    *AK    BOTH THE DRIVER AND PASSENGER SEAT BELTS FAILED AND THE DRIVER AND THE PASSENGER SUFFERED SEVER INJURIES .THE DRIVER OF V1 WAS INJURED AND REPORTEDLY DIED ABOUT 2 HOURS LATER.  *YH
ACCELLERATOR PEDAL BRACKET BROKE LOOSE FROM FIREWALL ON INTERSTATE, LOSS OF THROTTLE CONTROL, DEALER HAD NO PRIOR REPORTS
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK
VEHICLED HAD BEEN PARKED FOR ABOUT 7 HOURS AND ENGINE CAUGHT ON  FIRE.  FIRE INSPECTOR SAID IT  MAY HAVE BEEN BLOWER RESISTOR.  *AK

WHILE DRIVING VEHICLE ON THE HIGHWAY AT 65 MPH TRANSMISSION FAILED AND DRIVER WAS UNABLE TO CONTROL THE VEHICLE.  THE VEHICLE SPUN OUT OF CONTROL AND THE DRIVER AND VEHICLE ENDED UP IN THE DITCH. WHO STATED THAT THE TRANSMISSION FAILURE WAS CAUSED BECAUSE ALL OF THE OIL LEAKED OUT OF THE TRANSMISSION AND THAT FORD RANGER PICKUPS FOR PARTICULAR YEARS HAD THAT PROBLEM BECAUSE THE TRANSMISSION PLUGS WERE MADE OF PLASTIC AND EITHER LEAKED OR FELL OUT.  DRIVER HAD NO INDICATION PRIOR TO ACCIDENT THAT TRANSMISSION WAS LEAKING AND NEVER SAW ANY LEAKAGE OF TRANSMISSION FLUID WHEN THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED.  THE VEHICLE WAS OPERATING NORMALLY BEFORE THE ACCIDENT.  *AK

I WAS TRAVELLING AT 50 MPH AND PULLING A 14 FT ALUMINUM BOAT TO OUR CAMP. I HAD JUST WENT TO THE SERVICE STATION AND HAD MY OIL & FILER CHANGED AS WELL AS CHECKED THE TIRE PRESSURE ON ALL 4 TIRES & THE SPARE. APPROXIMATELY 1 HOUR LATER I WAS TRAVELING AT 50 MPH ON A STATE HIGHWAY AND THE LEFT REAR TIRE BLEW. IT JUST DID NOT GO FLAT, BUT BLEW. I RECALL THAT THERE WERE NO OBJECTS ON THE HIGHWAY THAT CAUSED THIS. THE TIRE WAS CHANGED AND I OBSERVED THAT THE TIRE LOOKED DEFECTIVE. THERE WERE NO EXTRERNAL MARKINGS OR PUNCTURES TO INDICATE A PROBLEM. I BROUGHT THIS TIRE TO THE FIRESTONE DEALER IN LAFAYETTE,LA ON JOHNSTON STREET AND HE SAID I RAN OVER SOMETHING, WHICH I KNEW I DID NOT. HE THOUGHT I HIT A CURB, WHICH IS IMPOSSIBLE SINCE THERE ARE NONE ON STATE HWY 82. HE THEN TELLS ME IT WAS PROBABLY LOW PRESSURE, WHICH I THEN INFORMED HIM IT WAS JUST CHECKED PRIOR TO STARTING MY TRIP. HE SAID HE WAS ALL OUT OF SUGGESTIONS. I SAID HOW ABOUT DEFECTIVE? TO WHICH HE REPLIED, PROBABLY NOT, THE TIRE IS LESS THAN 1 YEAR OLD. HE AND I OBSERVED THE TIRE WHICH SHOWS THE SIDEWALL PHYSICALLY TORE / SEPARATED FROM THE TREAD WITHOUT ANY PUNCTURES OR MARKINGS. HE REFUSED TO REPLACE THE TIRE UNDER WARRANTY. I NO LONGER BUY FIRESTONE TIRES AND I AM NOW CONVINCED THAT IT WAS A DEFECTIVE TIRE.  *AK( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: P265R15 )

ON TWO PREVIOUS OCCASIONS THE ACCELERATOR STUCK - MID 1998 - ONE ON A FREEWAY ON RAMP AND THE OTHER WHILE ACCELERATION WHILE TRAVELING 65 MPH ON THE FREEWAY.  I PUT THE VEHICLE INTO NEUTRAL AND TURNED OFF THE ENGINE WHEN STOPPED - IT WAS FINE UPON BEING RESTARTED.   I TOOK IT INTO A SHOP BUT THEY WERE UNABLE TO FIND ANYTHING APPARENTLY WRONG.  ON JULY 19,1999, WHILE TRAVELING 65 MPH ON THE FREEWAY, I BRIEFLY ACCELERATED.  THE ACCELERATOR AGAIN STUCK. I TAPPED ON THE BRAKE TO CHECK IF THAT WOULD HELP. (I WAS NOT USING CRUISE CONTROL AND SELDOM USE IT.)  THE VEHICLE CONTINUED TO ACCELERATE.  I THEN PUT THE GEAR INTO NEUTRAL - IT WAS AN AUTOMATIC.  THE WHEELS THEN FROZE/LOCKED WHICH CAUSED THE TRUCK TO SKID AND THEN ROLLOVER 1 1/2  TIMES.  I DID NOT APPLY THE BRAKES HOWEVER THERE WERE SKID MARKS ON THE ROADWAY.  THE TRUCK HAS BEEN WELL MAINTAINED AND OTHER THAN THIS PROBLEM FREE.
